tasks.title: Setup Project Repository and CI/CD Pipeline
tasks.description: Initialize the project repository with Astro, configure tooling (ESLint, Prettier, Husky), and set up CI/CD pipeline to Cloudflare Pages with preview branches.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new GitHub repository (private)
2. Initialize project with Astro framework
3. Configure ESLint with Astro-specific recommended rules
4. Set up Prettier for code formatting with Astro settings
5. Implement Husky for pre-commit hooks
6. Create GitHub Actions workflow file (.github/workflows/deploy.yml) to:
   - Build the Astro project
   - Deploy to Cloudflare Pages
   - Set up preview branches for PRs
7. Configure basic 404 page and SEO defaults using Astro's static output
8. Add README.md with project overview and Astro-specific setup instructions
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify all tooling works locally (ESLint, Prettier, Husky)
2. Test GitHub Actions workflow by pushing a commit
3. Confirm successful deployment to Cloudflare Pages
4. Validate preview branch functionality by creating a test PR
5. Check 404 page is properly served for non-existent routes
6. Verify Astro's static output performance metrics

subtasks.title: Create Repository
subtasks.description: Set up a new private GitHub repository for the project, including branch protections and access controls.
subtasks.details: Create a private GitHub repository. Configure branch protection rules for 'main' branch: require pull request reviews before merging, require status checks to pass before merging, and restrict who can push to matching branches. Set up access permissions following the principle of least privilege, with appropriate roles for solo development that can scale to a small team.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify repository settings, branch protection rules, and access controls are correctly configured.

subtasks.title: Initialize Astro Framework
subtasks.description: Initialize the Astro framework within the repository using the Astro CLI.
subtasks.details: Use the Astro CLI command 'npm create astro@latest' to scaffold the project structure. Select the appropriate template options for a portfolio/business website. Commit the initial codebase to the repository.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify Astro project structure is correctly initialized and runs locally with 'npm run dev'.

subtasks.title: Configure Tooling (ESLint, Prettier, Husky)
subtasks.description: Set up code quality and formatting tools, including ESLint for linting, Prettier for code formatting, and Husky for Git hooks.
subtasks.details: Install and configure ESLint with Astro-specific rules using 'eslint-plugin-astro'. Set up Prettier with Astro formatting support using 'prettier-plugin-astro'. Configure Husky to run linting and formatting checks on pre-commit.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test ESLint and Prettier configurations with Astro files. Verify Husky pre-commit hooks correctly enforce code quality standards.

subtasks.title: Set Up CI/CD Workflow
subtasks.description: Configure continuous integration and continuous deployment workflows using GitHub Actions.
subtasks.details: Create .github/workflows/deploy.yml to define pipeline stages for build and deploy. Configure the workflow to use Node.js and install dependencies, build the Astro project with 'npm run build', and prepare for deployment to Cloudflare Pages. Ensure jobs are optimized for speed and reliability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify GitHub Actions workflow runs successfully on push to the repository. Check build artifacts are correctly generated.

subtasks.title: Configure Deployment
subtasks.description: Set up deployment scripts and environment configurations for Cloudflare Pages.
subtasks.details: Configure Cloudflare Pages deployment using Astro's static output mode. Set the build command to 'npm run build' and the output directory to 'dist'. Manage environment variables securely through Cloudflare Pages dashboard. Ensure proper separation of development and production environments.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify successful deployment to Cloudflare Pages. Check that static assets are correctly served and the site loads properly.

subtasks.title: Enable Preview Branch Deployments
subtasks.description: Configure the CI/CD pipeline to deploy preview environments for feature or pull request branches.
subtasks.details: Set up Cloudflare Pages preview deployments for pull requests. Configure GitHub Actions workflow to trigger deployments for non-main branches. Ensure preview URLs are posted as comments on pull requests for easy access.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a test PR and verify a preview deployment is automatically created. Check the preview URL is accessible and displays the expected content.

subtasks.title: Set Up 404 Page and SEO Defaults
subtasks.description: Implement a custom 404 error page and configure default SEO metadata using Astro's capabilities.
subtasks.details: Create a 404.astro page in the pages directory. Configure default SEO metadata using Astro's built-in SEO features. Set up robots.txt and sitemap.xml using Astro integrations. Leverage Astro's static HTML output for optimal SEO performance.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test 404 page by accessing non-existent routes. Verify SEO metadata is correctly included in HTML output. Check robots.txt and sitemap.xml are properly generated.

subtasks.title: Write Documentation
subtasks.description: Document the repository structure, Astro-specific setup instructions, CI/CD workflow, deployment process, and contribution guidelines.
subtasks.details: Create a comprehensive README.md with: project overview, Astro-specific setup instructions, development workflow, deployment process, and contribution guidelines. Include information about the performance benefits of Astro (40% faster loading, 90% less JavaScript), SEO advantages, and Strapi integration capabilities.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review documentation for completeness and clarity. Verify setup instructions work for a new developer.

tasks.title: Implement Core Layout and Theme Components
tasks.description: Develop foundational UI components and layouts that embody a controlled collision of brutalist minimalism and expressive punk-art energy, while maintaining accessibility and brand authenticity. Ensure navigation, footer, typography, and responsive layout system reflect a bold, equity-driven, and creative design using Tailwind/SCSS with CSS Grid/Flexbox.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Tailwind CSS with custom configuration, prioritizing accessibility and privacy in all styles
2. Define CSS variables for design tokens (colors, typography, spacing) supporting a 70% monochrome base (white, near-black, greys, noise grain textures) and strategic accent colors (electric blue, coral pink, mint green, neon magenta, hazard-yellow, Web3-orange) for maximum impact
   - Typography: Oversized sans-serif headings, code brackets for tech elements, occasional serif for contrast
   - Layouts: Generous negative space, asymmetrical blocks, print-style grids that deliberately break rules
   - Masonry and asymmetric grid options for portfolio and content sections
3. Create layout components:
   - MainLayout.jsx with a print-style, asymmetric 12-column grid system for flexible, expressive content
   - Header/Navigation with split-personality (professional/rebellious) elements, clear labeling, and responsive, accessible menu
   - Footer with industrial overlays, transparent contact info, and punk/professional duality
4. Implement responsive breakpoints for desktop, tablet, and mobile, ensuring usability for all users and deliberate misalignment for visual interest
5. Create UI component library:
   - Buttons (primary, secondary, text) with bold, direct CTAs and punk-inspired micro-interactions (flickers, overlays)
   - Cards, section containers, and typography components supporting both structured and chaotic layouts
   - Components must be accessible, support creative/personal content, and include theme toggles (light/dark/punk)
6. Add GSAP or Framer Motion setup for generative hero animations (particle spelling), motion blur effects, glitch overlays, and accessible micro-interactions. All motion must respect prefers-reduced-motion and not interfere with usability.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test responsive, asymmetric layouts across multiple device sizes (320px to 1920px+), ensuring both structure and controlled chaos
2. Verify WCAG 2.2 AA compliance for color contrast and keyboard navigation, especially with high-impact accent colors
3. Test all interactive elements for accessibility, including ARIA attributes, screen reader support, and theme toggles
4. Validate component rendering and accessibility in different browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
5. Create Storybook stories for visual regression and accessibility testing, ensuring components reflect the punk-meets-professional brand voice and values

subtasks.title: Set Up Tailwind CSS and SCSS Environment
subtasks.description: Install and configure Tailwind CSS and SCSS, ensuring compatibility, optimal build tooling (PostCSS/Autoprefixer), and accessibility-first configuration. Prepare for custom brutalist/punk theming.
subtasks.details:
Follow Tailwind's recommendation to use PostCSS exclusively. Install dependencies and set up build scripts. Configure Tailwind for accessible color contrast, semantic class naming, and support for custom ARIA variants and theme toggles.
<info added on 2025-07-09T17:42:35.323Z>
Research confirms Tailwind CSS v4 is fully compatible with Astro 5.2+ using the new @tailwindcss/vite plugin. The @astrojs/tailwind integration is now deprecated. Implementation will use Tailwind CSS v4.1.11 with the native @tailwindcss/vite plugin for better performance and full v4 feature support. This approach eliminates the need for the deprecated @astrojs/tailwind integration and resolves compatibility issues. Configuration will include PostCSS setup for Tailwind v4 and Astro compatibility, with the Astro config updated to use the @tailwindcss/vite plugin directly.
</info added on 2025-07-09T17:42:35.323Z>

subtasks.title: Define and Document Design Tokens
subtasks.description: Establish a centralized set of design tokens (colors, spacing, typography, etc.) in tailwind.config.js for consistency, accessibility, and brand alignment with brutalist minimalism and expressive punk-art energy.
subtasks.details: Customize Tailwind configuration to include a 70% monochrome palette (white, near-black, greys, noise grain), strategic accent colors (electric blue, coral pink, mint green, neon magenta, hazard-yellow, Web3-orange), oversized sans-serif and occasional serif typography, and CSS variables for theme toggling. Document tokens for team reference, emphasizing accessibility and bold creative intent.

subtasks.title: Implement Asymmetric and Masonry Grid Systems
subtasks.description: Create responsive, accessible grid systems using Tailwind's utility classes and custom CSS for asymmetric, print-style, and masonry layouts that support both structured and chaotic information architecture.
subtasks.details: Utilize and extend Tailwind's grid/flex utilities for asymmetric and masonry layouts. Add custom breakpoints and columns as needed. Ensure layouts are easy to navigate, visually impactful, and accessible.

subtasks.title: Develop Split-Personality Navigation Component
subtasks.description: Build a responsive, accessible navigation bar using Tailwind utilities, reflecting the professional/rebellious duality with bold, honest labeling and punk-inspired micro-interactions.
subtasks.details:
Include keyboard navigation, ARIA attributes, theme toggles (light/dark/punk), and clear, value-driven menu labels. Test navigation across breakpoints and with assistive technologies.
<info added on 2025-07-09T18:11:56.728Z>
Research findings indicate the navigation styling issues are caused by improper integration between design tokens and Tailwind CSS v4. The solution requires implementing CSS custom properties for design tokens that work seamlessly with both Tailwind utilities and scoped styles. Theme switching should be handled through data attributes with CSS variables rather than switching between custom token classes and standard Tailwind classes. Component-specific effects should utilize Astro's scoped styles to prevent conflicts while maintaining consistency. Design tokens must be synchronized between CSS variables and Tailwind configuration to ensure a unified theming approach that leverages Tailwind's utility classes for layout and interactions while using CSS variables for dynamic theming.
</info added on 2025-07-09T18:11:56.728Z>

subtasks.title: Develop Industrial/Punk Footer Component
subtasks.description: Create a footer component styled with Tailwind, featuring industrial overlays, noise textures, and punk/professional duality. Ensure accessibility and transparent, empowering messaging.
subtasks.details:
Include social/community links, copyright, and any required widgets. Ensure accessibility, privacy, and mobile responsiveness. Use overlays and glitch effects for visual interest.
<info added on 2025-07-09T18:20:50.219Z>
LESSONS LEARNED from Navigation Component Development:

KEY INSIGHTS:
1. **CSS Variables Work Best**: Direct CSS variables (var(--color-text-primary)) work better than Tailwind theme classes for dynamic theming
2. **Inline Styles for Theme-Aware Elements**: Use inline styles with CSS variables for elements that need to change with theme toggling
3. **Tailwind for Layout, CSS Variables for Colors**: Tailwind utilities work great for layout/spacing, but CSS variables are more reliable for colors that need to change dynamically
4. **Responsive Design Needs Media Queries**: Tailwind's responsive utilities work well, but some complex responsive behavior needs custom CSS media queries
5. **Debugging Strategy**: When complex styling fails, simplify to basic HTML/CSS first, then gradually add complexity

UPDATED FOOTER APPROACH:
- Use inline CSS variables for theme-aware colors (backgrounds, text, borders)
- Use Tailwind utilities for layout, spacing, and positioning
- Implement industrial/punk effects with CSS variables and custom animations
- Test with simple styling first, then add complexity
- Ensure responsive design works across all breakpoints

This approach will prevent the styling conflicts we encountered with the navigation component.
</info added on 2025-07-09T18:20:50.219Z>

subtasks.title: Configure Responsive Breakpoints and Deliberate Misalignment
subtasks.description: Define and document custom responsive breakpoints in tailwind.config.js to match design requirements, support asymmetric layouts, and ensure accessibility for all users.
subtasks.details: Adopt a mobile-first approach, ensure all components adapt gracefully to different screen sizes, and introduce deliberate misalignment for controlled chaos. Prioritize accessibility and creative expression.

subtasks.title: Build Core Component Library with Punk/Brutalist Variants
subtasks.description: Develop reusable, accessible UI components (buttons, cards, containers, typography) using Tailwind and SCSS, supporting both structured and chaotic layouts, and including punk/brutalist variants.
subtasks.details:
Ensure components use design tokens, are documented for usage and variants, and support technical, personal, and creative content. Include micro-interactions (flickers, overlays, slide-ins) and theme toggles. Prioritize accessibility and bold creative intent.
<info added on 2025-07-09T18:49:56.645Z>
UPDATED COMPONENT LIBRARY APPROACH based on Navigation lessons:

STYLING STRATEGY:
1. **Hybrid Approach**: Use Tailwind for layout/spacing + CSS variables for theme-aware colors
2. **Component Architecture**: 
   - Base HTML structure with Tailwind classes
   - Theme-aware colors via inline CSS variables
   - Custom animations/effects via CSS variables
3. **Testing Strategy**: Build simple version first, then add complexity
4. **Responsive Design**: Combine Tailwind responsive utilities with custom media queries when needed

COMPONENT PRIORITIES:
- Button components (primary, secondary, text) with punk micro-interactions
- Card components with industrial overlays
- Typography components with theme-aware colors
- Container components with asymmetric layouts

Each component will follow the proven pattern: Tailwind for structure, CSS variables for theming, custom CSS for special effects.
</info added on 2025-07-09T18:49:56.645Z>

tasks.title: Deploy Headless CMS (Strapi)
tasks.description: Set up and deploy Strapi as the headless CMS on AWS EC2 (t3.micro) with content models for Media, Service (with tiered pricing, descriptions, feature highlights, pin/highlight, slug), Bio, and SiteSettings.
tasks.details:
1. Provision AWS infrastructure using Terraform:
   - EC2 t3.micro instance
   - S3 bucket for asset storage
   - Security groups and IAM roles
2. Install and configure Strapi CMS:
   - Set up with SQLite initially (PostgreSQL upgrade-ready)
3. Define content models in Strapi:
   - Media: id, title, type(enum), url, embedCode, tags[], length, createdAt
   - Service: id, title, category/type, description, featureHighlights[], tiers[{name, priceLow, priceHigh, deliverables}], contactMethod, isPinned, slug
   - Bio: markdown, socialLinks[]
   - SiteSettings: various configuration options
4. Configure API endpoints (GraphQL and REST, as supported by Strapi)
5. Set up user authentication and permissions in Strapi
6. Configure S3 for media uploads via Strapi's upload provider
7. Implement weekly database snapshots for backup

4. Test media upload functionality to S3 via Strapi

tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test Strapi API integration with mock data, ensuring privacy and security
2. Verify accessible filter functionality works correctly for all users
3. Test responsive, asymmetric grid layout and accessibility across device sizes
4. Validate performance with large number of items
5. Test accessible animations and transitions (motion blur, glitch, flicker)
6. Verify accessibility of filter controls and content parseability by AI/humans
7. Test cache invalidation when content updates

subtasks.title: Design Masonry/Asymmetric Grid Layout Structure
subtasks.description: Define the overall grid layout structure, including breakpoints, column counts, spacing, and deliberate misalignment for accessibility and punk/brutalist visual energy.
subtasks.details: Plan how grid items will be arranged across different screen sizes, using CSS Grid/Flexbox for controlled chaos. Align with the services grid for a unified, bold look.

subtasks.title: Integrate Strapi API
subtasks.description: Set up integration with the Strapi API to fetch dynamic content for the grid, ensuring privacy and security best practices.
subtasks.details: Implement API calls and data fetching logic to retrieve content from Strapi that will populate the grid layout. Ensure all data handling respects privacy and accessibility.

subtasks.title: Implement Punk/Brutalist Filter Bar
subtasks.description: Develop an accessible filter bar component with bold, oversized typography and punk-inspired accents to allow users to filter grid items based on categories or tags.
subtasks.details: Connect filter bar state to grid data and ensure seamless, accessible filtering of content. Match filter UX with the services grid for consistency and boldness.

subtasks.title: Create Media Card Components with Micro-interactions
subtasks.description: Build reusable, accessible media card components to display individual content items within the grid, supporting technical, personal, and creative content, with punk-inspired micro-interactions.
subtasks.details: Design cards to display images, titles, descriptions, and other relevant metadata. Add flicker, glitch, or overlay effects for visual interest. Ensure accessibility and support for diverse content types.

subtasks.title: Implement Lazy Loading
subtasks.description: Add lazy loading functionality to load grid items as they enter the viewport, optimizing performance and accessibility.
subtasks.details: Optimize initial load time and improve performance by only rendering visible items. Ensure lazy loading is accessible and does not hinder usability.

subtasks.title: Develop Caching Strategy
subtasks.description: Implement a caching mechanism for Strapi API responses and grid data to reduce redundant network requests, respecting privacy and security.
subtasks.details: Use browser storage or in-memory caching to store fetched data and improve user experience. Ensure all caching strategies respect user privacy.

subtasks.title: Set Up Animations with Motion Blur and Glitch Effects
subtasks.description: Add accessible animations for grid item transitions, filtering, and loading states, using GSAP/Framer Motion for motion blur, glitch, and slide-in effects.
subtasks.details: Ensure smooth and visually impactful transitions when items are added, removed, or filtered. All animations must respect prefers-reduced-motion and accessibility guidelines.

subtasks.title: Ensure Responsive Design with Deliberate Misalignment
subtasks.description: Test and refine the grid layout and components to ensure optimal, accessible display on all device sizes, with deliberate misalignment for punk/brutalist energy.
subtasks.details: Adjust breakpoints, spacing, and component sizing for mobile, tablet, and desktop views. Prioritize accessibility, clarity, and bold creative intent.

subtasks.title: Implement Accessibility Features for Chaotic Layouts
subtasks.description: Enhance accessibility by adding ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support to all grid and filter components, with special attention to high-contrast and chaotic layouts.
subtasks.details: Ensure all interactive elements are accessible and comply with WCAG guidelines. Prioritize equity-driven design and empowerment.

subtasks.title: Conduct Performance Testing
subtasks.description: Test the application for performance bottlenecks, including rendering speed, memory usage, and responsiveness, ensuring accessibility and privacy are not compromised.
subtasks.details: Use profiling tools to identify and address any issues affecting user experience, accessibility, or privacy.

tasks.title: Implement Dynamic Media Detail Page
tasks.description: Create a dynamic media.html?media={id} page that loads the chosen asset from Strapi and renders it appropriately based on media type (embed, markdown, etc.).
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test route handling with various media IDs
2. Verify each renderer component works correctly
3. Test social sharing functionality
4. Validate SEO metadata generation
5. Test responsive layout for different media types
6. Verify deep-linking works correctly
7. Test error handling for invalid media IDs

subtasks.title: Set Up Dynamic Routing
subtasks.description: Implement a routing system that dynamically generates routes based on media content identifiers or slugs.
subtasks.details: Ensure the routing logic supports deep-linking and can handle various media types. Test with sample data to verify route generation.

subtasks.title: Integrate Single Media API from Strapi
subtasks.description: Connect to the Strapi media API to fetch content details for individual media items.
subtasks.details: Research Strapi API endpoints, authentication, response formats, and error handling mechanisms. Implement API calls and handle responses according to best practices.

subtasks.title: Develop Renderer Components by Media Type
subtasks.description: Create modular renderer components that display content based on the media type (e.g., video, image, audio, article).
subtasks.details: Design each renderer to handle its specific data structure and presentation needs. Ensure components are reusable and maintainable.

subtasks.title: Implement Social Sharing Functionality
subtasks.description: Add social sharing buttons and logic to allow users to share media content on various platforms.
subtasks.details: Integrate with popular social APIs and ensure shared links support deep-linking to the specific media item.

subtasks.title: Build Related Content Carousel
subtasks.description: Develop a carousel component that displays related media items based on the current content.
subtasks.details: Fetch related content from Strapi API and design the carousel for smooth navigation and accessibility.

subtasks.title: Implement SEO Metadata Handling
subtasks.description: Dynamically generate and inject SEO metadata (title, description, Open Graph tags) for each media route.
subtasks.details: Ensure metadata reflects the current media content and supports social sharing previews.

subtasks.title: Enable Deep-Linking Support
subtasks.description: Ensure that each media item can be accessed directly via a unique URL, supporting navigation and sharing.
subtasks.details: Test deep-linking across devices and platforms to verify correct content loading and metadata rendering.

subtasks.title: Implement Robust Error Handling
subtasks.description: Add standardized error handling for Strapi API failures, invalid routes, and rendering issues.
subtasks.details: Display user-friendly error messages and log errors for debugging. Follow best practices for consistent error formats.

subtasks.title: Ensure Responsive Design
subtasks.description: Adapt all components and layouts to provide an optimal experience across devices and screen sizes.
subtasks.details: Test UI elements, carousels, and renderers on multiple devices and browsers. Address accessibility and usability concerns.

tasks.title: Migrate Services to Strapi CMS
tasks.description: Migrate all consulting service data (Virtual CIO, IT Support, Consulting, Project Management, Automation, Data Analysis, Cloud Migration, Cybersecurity, Website Development, Training, etc.) into Strapi, implement the tiered pricing matrix, pin/highlight logic, and connect the front-end to the Strapi API for dynamic, filterable, and sortable service display and detail pages.
tasks.details:
1. Ensure Service content model is properly configured in Strapi (fields for title, description, type, feature highlights, tiers, contactMethod, isPinned, slug)
2. Migrate all static service data to Strapi
3. Update front-end to fetch services from Strapi API and remove all static data
4. Implement tiered pricing display and filtering logic
5. Update service cards and detail pages to use dynamic data
6. Add contact CTAs (mailto or Calendly) based on contactMethod field
7. Implement caching strategy for service data
8. Update structured data for SEO with dynamic content
9. Ensure pin/highlight logic is respected in the UI
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Strapi API integration works correctly
2. Test service rendering with various tier configurations
3. Validate CTA functionality based on contactMethod
4. Test caching and revalidation
5. Verify structured data generation
6. Test responsive layout with dynamic content
7. Validate error handling for API failures
8. Confirm pin/highlight logic is reflected in the UI

subtasks.title: Strapi Model Validation
subtasks.description: Validate the Strapi model's input, calculation, and output components to ensure data integrity and compliance with business rules. Confirm support for tiered pricing, feature highlights, pin/highlight, and slug.
subtasks.details: Perform input validation (length, type, range, syntax), calculation logic checks (sensitivity testing, dynamic validation), and output verification (format, clarity, consistency with historical data).

subtasks.title: Data Migration Planning
subtasks.description: Plan and document the migration of all existing service data to the new Strapi structure, ensuring data mapping and transformation requirements are defined.
subtasks.details: Identify data sources, define mapping rules, and outline transformation logic needed for compatibility with the new Strapi schema.

subtasks.title: Data Migration Execution
subtasks.description: Execute the migration of all service data into Strapi, applying validation and transformation rules as defined in the planning phase.
subtasks.details: Migrate data in batches, validate migrated records for accuracy, and resolve any data integrity issues encountered.

subtasks.title: Strapi API Integration Implementation
subtasks.description: Integrate external or internal APIs with Strapi to enable dynamic data exchange and service connectivity. Remove all static service data from the frontend.
subtasks.details: Develop and test Strapi API endpoints, handle authentication, and ensure data flows correctly between systems. Refactor frontend to consume only CMS-driven service data.

subtasks.title: Tiered Pricing and Filtering Component Development
subtasks.description: Design and implement tiered pricing and filtering components within the frontend to support multiple pricing levels, business rules, and user-driven filtering/sorting.
subtasks.details: Define pricing tiers, implement logic for tier assignment, filtering, and sorting. Ensure integration with product/service data and UI.

subtasks.title: Dynamic Service Card and Detail Page Update
subtasks.description: Enable dynamic updates to service cards and detail pages in the CMS UI based on real-time data and user interactions, including pin/highlight logic.
subtasks.details: Implement frontend logic to fetch and display updated service information from Strapi, ensuring responsiveness, accuracy, and pin/highlight display.

subtasks.title: CTA Logic Implementation
subtasks.description: Develop and integrate call-to-action (CTA) logic that adapts based on user behavior, service availability, and pricing tiers.
subtasks.details: Define CTA triggers, implement conditional logic, and test for correct behavior across user scenarios.

subtasks.title: Caching and SEO Structured Data Update
subtasks.description: Implement caching strategies for performance and update SEO structured data to reflect dynamic content changes from Strapi.
subtasks.details: Configure server/client-side caching, update structured data tags for SEO, and validate with search engine tools.

tasks.title: Implement Collaboration Form ('We Could')
tasks.description: Create the 'We Could' collaboration form by embedding Jira Service Management request form and implementing the success/thank-you flow.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Jira Service Management project for collaboration requests
2. Create a form page with appropriate layout and instructions
3. Implement Jira Service Management iframe embed:
```html
<iframe 
  src="https://[account].atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/[portal]/[form]?projectKey=Collab" 
  width="100%" 
  height="600px"
  title="Collaboration Request Form"
></iframe>
```
4. Create fallback HTML form for cases where iframe fails:
```html
<form id="fallback-form" class="hidden">
  <!-- Form fields matching Jira requirements -->
</form>
```
5. Implement Zapier or custom webhook to connect fallback form to Jira API
6. Create success/thank-you page with next steps
7. Add form validation and error handling
8. Implement analytics tracking for form submissions
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test Jira iframe embedding
2. Verify form submissions create Jira tickets correctly
3. Test fallback form functionality
4. Validate form across different browsers and devices
5. Test error handling and validation
6. Verify success flow and redirects
7. Test analytics tracking for conversions

subtasks.title: Jira Project Setup
subtasks.description: Establish a new Jira project, select appropriate templates, configure project keys and naming conventions, and set up initial workflows.
subtasks.details: Decide on project structure (by team, product, or department), choose the Jira Classic template for flexibility, and define project goals and user roles.

subtasks.title: Form Page Layout Design
subtasks.description: Design the layout for the form page, ensuring a user-friendly interface and clear structure for form fields and instructions.
subtasks.details: Create wireframes or mockups, define field placements, and ensure accessibility and responsiveness.

subtasks.title: Jira Iframe Embed Implementation
subtasks.description: Integrate the Jira form into the page using an iframe, ensuring seamless embedding and compatibility with the page layout.
subtasks.details: Configure iframe settings, test cross-origin policies, and ensure the embedded form displays correctly within the designed layout.

subtasks.title: Fallback Form Implementation
subtasks.description: Develop a fallback form to be used if the Jira iframe fails to load or is unsupported, ensuring uninterrupted user experience.
subtasks.details: Implement logic to detect iframe issues and display the fallback form, mirroring the fields and validation of the embedded form.

subtasks.title: Webhook Integration
subtasks.description: Set up webhooks to connect Jira form submissions with external systems or services as needed.
subtasks.details: Configure Jira webhooks to trigger on form submission, define payload structure, and test integration with target endpoints.

subtasks.title: Success/Thank-You Flow Implementation
subtasks.description: Design and implement the user flow for successful form submission, including thank-you messaging and any follow-up actions.
subtasks.details: Display confirmation messages, provide next steps or links, and ensure consistent experience for both embedded and fallback forms.

subtasks.title: Validation and Error Handling
subtasks.description: Implement robust validation for form inputs and comprehensive error handling for both embedded and fallback forms.
subtasks.details: Define validation rules, display user-friendly error messages, and handle submission failures gracefully.

subtasks.title: Analytics Tracking Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate analytics tracking to monitor form usage, submission rates, errors, and user interactions.
subtasks.details: Set up tracking for key events (form load, submission, errors), configure analytics tools, and ensure data privacy compliance.

tasks.title: Implement Performance Optimizations
tasks.description: Optimize the site for performance with lazy-loading images, Lighthouse score improvements, and implementation of sitemap.xml and RSS feed.
tasks.details:
1. Implement image optimization:
   - Use next/image or astro:assets for automatic optimization
   - Configure responsive image sizes
   - Implement lazy loading for off-screen images
2. Add performance monitoring:
   - Configure Core Web Vitals measurement
   - Set up Lighthouse CI in GitHub Actions
3. Optimize JavaScript:
   - Code splitting for large components
   - Defer non-critical JavaScript
4. Implement caching strategies:
   - Static generation where possible
   - Incremental Static Regeneration for dynamic content
   - Browser caching headers
5. Create sitemap.xml generator
6. Implement RSS feed for content updates
7. Add service worker for offline capability
8. Optimize font loading with font-display: swap
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run Lighthouse audits targeting score ≥90 in all categories
2. Test performance on low-end devices and slow connections
3. Verify Core Web Vitals metrics (LCP, FID, CLS)
4. Validate sitemap.xml format and content
5. Test RSS feed in feed readers
6. Measure and verify load time improvements
7. Test offline functionality with service worker

subtasks.title: Image Optimization
subtasks.description: Compress, resize, and convert images to appropriate formats (JPEG, PNG, SVG, WebP) and implement responsive and lazy-loaded images.
subtasks.details: Use tools like TinyPNG or Compressor.io for compression. Ensure images are served in optimal formats and sizes for different devices. Implement lazy loading for offscreen images.

subtasks.title: JavaScript Optimization
subtasks.description: Minify, combine, and defer JavaScript files to reduce load times and improve execution efficiency.
subtasks.details: Remove unnecessary characters and comments, combine scripts where possible, and defer non-critical scripts. Use tools like Webpack, Grunt, or Gulp for automation.

subtasks.title: Caching Strategies Implementation
subtasks.description: Configure browser and server caching for static assets to reduce load times for repeat visitors.
subtasks.details: Set appropriate cache-control and expires headers for images, CSS, and JS. Consider using a CDN for distributed caching.

subtasks.title: Performance Monitoring Setup
subtasks.description: Integrate tools to continuously monitor site performance and identify bottlenecks.
subtasks.details: Set up tools like Google Lighthouse, WebPageTest, or New Relic. Configure alerts for performance regressions.

subtasks.title: Sitemap.xml Generation
subtasks.description: Create and maintain a sitemap.xml file to improve search engine indexing and crawl efficiency.
subtasks.details: Generate a sitemap.xml reflecting all important site URLs. Automate updates as site structure changes.

subtasks.title: RSS Feed Implementation
subtasks.description: Develop and expose an RSS feed for site content to support syndication and user subscriptions.
subtasks.details: Generate an RSS feed that updates automatically with new content. Validate feed for compatibility.

subtasks.title: Service Worker Setup
subtasks.description: Implement a service worker to enable offline capabilities and advanced caching strategies.
subtasks.details: Register a service worker that caches key assets and enables offline access. Test for correct cache invalidation and updates.

subtasks.title: Font Loading Optimization
subtasks.description: Optimize web font loading to minimize render-blocking and improve perceived performance.
subtasks.details: Use font-display: swap, preload key fonts, and subset font files to reduce size and loading time.

subtasks.title: Lighthouse CI Integration
subtasks.description: Integrate Lighthouse CI into the development workflow for automated performance audits.
subtasks.details: Set up Lighthouse CI to run on pull requests or deployments, generating reports and enforcing performance budgets.

subtasks.title: Offline Testing
subtasks.description: Test site functionality and user experience in offline and poor network conditions.
subtasks.details: Simulate offline scenarios using browser DevTools and verify that critical features and pages remain accessible.

tasks.title: Add Animation and Micro-interactions
tasks.description: Implement subtle motion cues and micro-interactions using GSAP or Framer Motion to enhance the user experience.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test animations across different browsers and devices
2. Verify prefers-reduced-motion support
3. Measure performance impact of animations
4. Test accessibility with animations enabled/disabled
5. Validate animations don't cause layout shifts
6. Test with throttled CPU to ensure smooth performance

subtasks.title: Animation Library Setup
subtasks.description: Select and install a suitable React animation library (e.g., Framer Motion) based on project requirements, performance, compatibility, and developer experience.
subtasks.details: Evaluate libraries for GPU acceleration, SSR support, documentation, and ease of integration. Install the chosen library using npm or yarn.

subtasks.title: Implement Animations by Type
subtasks.description: Develop and integrate animations for various UI elements (e.g., enter/exit transitions, hover effects, page transitions) using the chosen library.
subtasks.details: Use the library's API to implement different animation types as required by the UI/UX design.

subtasks.title: Create Custom Animation Hooks
subtasks.description: Develop reusable custom React hooks to encapsulate animation logic and simplify usage across components.
subtasks.details: Abstract common animation patterns into hooks for consistency and maintainability.

subtasks.title: Support Prefers-Reduced-Motion
subtasks.description: Implement logic to detect and respect the user's 'prefers-reduced-motion' system setting, disabling or simplifying animations as needed.
subtasks.details: Use CSS media queries or JavaScript APIs to check for reduced motion preferences and adjust animation behavior accordingly.

subtasks.title: Lazy-Load Animation Libraries
subtasks.description: Optimize performance by configuring the application to lazy-load animation libraries only when animations are needed.
subtasks.details: Implement dynamic imports or code-splitting strategies to reduce initial bundle size and improve load times.

subtasks.title: Build Reusable Animation Components
subtasks.description: Develop modular, reusable animation components that can be easily integrated and customized throughout the application.
subtasks.details: Encapsulate animation logic and props in well-documented components for consistent use.

subtasks.title: Accessibility Validation
subtasks.description: Test and validate that all animations meet accessibility standards, including keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility, and reduced motion support.
subtasks.details: Conduct manual and automated accessibility testing to ensure compliance and a positive user experience for all users.

tasks.title: Implement PWA Capabilities
tasks.description: Add Progressive Web App capabilities including installability, offline access, and push notifications.
tasks.details:
1. Create manifest.json file:
```json
{
  "name": "Chris's Portfolio & Services",
  "short_name": "Portfolio",
  "start_url": "/",
  "display": "standalone",
  "background_color": "#F5F5F5",
  "theme_color": "#00C6AE",
  "icons": [
    {
      "src": "/icons/icon-192.png",
      "sizes": "192x192",
      "type": "image/png"
    },
    {
      "src": "/icons/icon-512.png",
      "sizes": "512x512",
      "type": "image/png"
    }
  ]
}
```
2. Implement comprehensive service worker:
   - Cache static assets
   - Implement offline fallback pages
   - Cache API responses
3. Create app icons in various sizes
4. Add install prompt handling
5. Implement basic push notification support
6. Add offline content sync
7. Test installability across devices
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify PWA installability on desktop and mobile
2. Test offline functionality by disabling network
3. Validate service worker registration and updates
4. Test push notification functionality
5. Verify manifest.json is correctly configured
6. Test on various browsers and devices
7. Validate Lighthouse PWA score

subtasks.title: Create manifest.json
subtasks.description: Develop the web app manifest file containing metadata such as app name, icons, theme color, and display settings. Ensure it is placed in the root directory and linked in the HTML head.
subtasks.details: Include required fields like name, short_name, icons (multiple sizes), start_url, display, background_color, and theme_color.

subtasks.title: Generate App Icons
subtasks.description: Design and export app icons in various required sizes (e.g., 512x512px, 192x192px) in PNG format and reference them in the manifest.json.
subtasks.details: Ensure icons are optimized for different devices and platforms, and verify their inclusion in the manifest file.

subtasks.title: Implement Service Worker
subtasks.description: Develop and register a service worker script to enable offline capabilities, caching, and background processes.
subtasks.details: Implement caching strategies for static assets and fallback mechanisms for offline access.

subtasks.title: Handle Install Prompt
subtasks.description: Implement logic to detect and display the PWA install prompt to users, ensuring a smooth installation experience.
subtasks.details: Listen for the 'beforeinstallprompt' event and provide a custom UI to encourage installation.

subtasks.title: Set Up Push Notifications
subtasks.description: Configure push notification support using the service worker, including subscription management and notification display.
subtasks.details: Integrate with a push service, request user permission, and handle incoming push events in the service worker.

subtasks.title: Implement Offline Content Sync
subtasks.description: Enable background sync and offline content updates using the service worker to ensure data consistency when connectivity is restored.
subtasks.details: Use Background Sync API or similar mechanisms to queue and synchronize data changes made while offline.

subtasks.title: Conduct Cross-Device Testing
subtasks.description: Test the PWA across various devices, browsers, and operating systems to ensure consistent behavior and appearance.
subtasks.details: Verify installation, offline functionality, push notifications, and UI responsiveness on multiple platforms.

subtasks.title: Validate with Lighthouse PWA Audit
subtasks.description: Run Lighthouse audits to evaluate PWA compliance, performance, accessibility, and best practices, and address any identified issues.
subtasks.details: Iterate on the implementation based on Lighthouse feedback to achieve a high PWA score.
